In *[NetHack](/wiki/NetHack "NetHack")*, the letter **M** serves the following purposes:

- m represents a [mimic](/wiki/Mimic "Mimic") (when it is not disguised as something else):

  - m [small mimic](/wiki/Small_mimic "Small mimic")
  - m [large mimic](/wiki/Large_mimic "Large mimic")
  - m [giant mimic](/wiki/Giant_mimic "Giant mimic")

* M represents a [mummy](/wiki/Mummy "Mummy"):

  - M [kobold mummy](/wiki/Kobold_mummy "Kobold mummy")
  - M [gnome mummy](/wiki/Gnome_mummy "Gnome mummy")
  - M [orc mummy](/wiki/Orc_mummy "Orc mummy")
  - M [dwarf mummy](/wiki/Dwarf_mummy "Dwarf mummy")
  - M [elf mummy](/wiki/Elf_mummy "Elf mummy")
  - M [human mummy](/wiki/Human_mummy "Human mummy")
  - M [ettin mummy](/wiki/Ettin_mummy "Ettin mummy")
  - M [giant mummy](/wiki/Giant_mummy "Giant mummy")

- Press [m](), then a direction, to move your character without performing any other actions (such as attacking a [monster](/wiki/Monster "Monster") or displacing a [pet](/wiki/Pet "Pet").
  - Even if [autopickup](/wiki/Autopickup "Autopickup") is on, using [m]() causes you not to pick up anything. It will also stop you from attacking I, and will even stop you feeling items on the floor if [blind](/wiki/Blind "Blind"), such as a [cockatrice](/wiki/Cockatrice "Cockatrice") or [chickatrice](/wiki/Chickatrice "Chickatrice") [corpse](/wiki/Corpse "Corpse"). **Beware**: you will always hit a [warning](/wiki/Warning "Warning") symbol, and will also still attack a monster [engulfing](/wiki/Engulfing "Engulfing") you.
- Press [m]()[,](/wiki/, ",") to [pick up](/wiki/Pick_up "Pick up") items off the floor using a menu.
- Press [Shift](/wiki/Shift "Shift") + [M](), then a direction, to move your character as far as they can go in that direction. The character will not stop at items or corridor forks. See the article on [movement](/wiki/Movement "Movement") for a comparison to other movement prefixes.

[ ]

## Contents

- [1 Historical uses](#Historical_uses)

- [2 Variants](#Variants)

  - [2.1 SLASH'EM](#SLASH.27EM)
  - [2.2 dNetHack](#dNetHack)
  - [2.3 SpliceHack](#SpliceHack)
  - [2.4 EvilHack](#EvilHack)
  - [2.5 SlashTHEM](#SlashTHEM)
  - [2.6 Hack'EM](#Hack.27EM)

## Historical uses

In Hack 1.21, based on [Jay Fenlason's Hack](/wiki/Jay_Fenlason%27s_Hack "Jay Fenlason's Hack"), [minotaurs](/wiki/Minotaur "Minotaur") used the m glyph, while mega-worms used the M glyph; in Hack for PDP-11, the m glyph is given to the [mimic](/wiki/Small_mimic "Small mimic"). Both minotaurs and mimics retain their glyphs for their appearance in [Hack 1.0](/wiki/Hack_1.0 "Hack 1.0"), and continue to use those glyphs up to [NetHack 2.3e](/wiki/NetHack_2.3e "NetHack 2.3e").

In [NetHack 3.0.0](/wiki/NetHack_3.0.0 "NetHack 3.0.0"), the [mimic](/wiki/Mimic "Mimic") [monster class](/wiki/Monster_class "Monster class") is introduced and the three sizes of mimic are differentiated from each other, while the mummies are introduced and given the M glyph; the minotaur is moved to the [giant humanoid](/wiki/Giant_humanoid "Giant humanoid") monster class, H.

## Variants

Relatively few variants add new monsters to the mimic monster class.

### SLASH'EM

[SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM") introduces one new monster that uses the M glyph:

- M mummy
  - M [troll mummy](/wiki/Troll_mummy "Troll mummy")

### dNetHack

[dNetHack](/wiki/DNetHack "DNetHack") adds several new monsters that use the M glyph:

- M mummy

  - M [drow mummy](/wiki/Drow_mummy "Drow mummy")
  - M [half-dragon mummy](/wiki/Half-dragon_mummy "Half-dragon mummy")
  - M [chiropteran mummy](/wiki/Chiropteran_mummy "Chiropteran mummy")
  - M [mummified android](/index.php?title=Mummified_android\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Mummified android (page does not exist)")
  - M [mummified gynoid](/index.php?title=Mummified_gynoid\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Mummified gynoid (page does not exist)")
  - M [alabaster mummy](/index.php?title=Alabaster_mummy\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Alabaster mummy (page does not exist)")
  - M [soldier mummy](/wiki/Soldier_mummy "Soldier mummy")
  - M [priest mummy](/index.php?title=Priest_mummy\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Priest mummy (page does not exist)")
  - M [pharaoh](/wiki/Pharaoh "Pharaoh")
  - M [Nitocris](/index.php?title=Nitocris\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Nitocris (page does not exist)")
  - M [Ghoul-queen Nitocris](/index.php?title=Ghoul-queen_Nitocris\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Ghoul-queen Nitocris (page does not exist)")
  - M [strange corpse](/wiki/Strange_corpse "Strange corpse")

### SpliceHack

[SpliceHack](/wiki/SpliceHack "SpliceHack") adds two new monsters that use the m and M glyphs:

- m mimic
  - m [killer mimic](/index.php?title=Killer_mimic\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Killer mimic (page does not exist)")
- M mummy
  - M [adherer](/index.php?title=Adherer\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Adherer (page does not exist)")

### EvilHack

[EvilHack](/wiki/EvilHack "EvilHack") adds two new monsters that use the M glyph:

- M mummy

  - M [hobbit mummy](/wiki/Hobbit_mummy "Hobbit mummy")
  - M [drow mummy](/index.php?title=Drow_mummy_\(EvilHack\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Drow mummy (EvilHack) (page does not exist)")

### SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, [SlashTHEM](/wiki/SlashTHEM "SlashTHEM") adds two new monsters that use the M glyph:

- M mummy

  - M [drow mummy](/index.php?title=Drow_mummy_\(SlashTHEM\)\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Drow mummy (SlashTHEM) (page does not exist)")
  - M [ogre mummy](/index.php?title=Ogre_mummy\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Ogre mummy (page does not exist)")

### Hack'EM

Hack'EM adds a few new monsters that use the M glyph, including some from other variants:

- M mummy

  - M [hobbit mummy](/wiki/Hobbit_mummy "Hobbit mummy")
  - M [centaur mummy](/index.php?title=Centaur_mummy\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Centaur mummy (page does not exist)")
  - M [adherer](/index.php?title=Adherer\&action=edit\&redlink=1 "Adherer (page does not exist)")
  - M [troll mummy](/wiki/Troll_mummy "Troll mummy")

[![This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.](/images/f/f7/Nh367-icon.png)](/wiki/NetHackWiki:Next_version "This article has been updated to reflect NetHack 3.6.7. Click here for more information.")

M

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
Printable ASCII characters
~ ! @ # $ % ^ & * ( ) _ + space
` 1 2 3 4 5 6 7 8 9 0 - = { } |
Qq Ww Ee Rr Tt Yy Uu Ii Oo Pp : " [ ] \
Aa Ss Dd Ff Gg Hh Jj Kk Ll ? ; ' Ctrl
Zz Xx Cc Vv Bb Nn Mm , . / < > Alt

In NetHack, the letter M serves the following purposes:

  • m represents a mimic (when it is not disguised as something else):
    • m small mimic
    • m large mimic
    • m giant mimic
  • M represents a mummy:
    • M kobold mummy
    • M gnome mummy
    • M orc mummy
    • M dwarf mummy
    • M elf mummy
    • M human mummy
    • M ettin mummy
    • M giant mummy
  • Press m, then a direction, to move your character without performing any other actions (such as attacking a monster or displacing a pet.
    • Even if autopickup is on, using m causes you not to pick up anything. It will also stop you from attacking I, and will even stop you feeling items on the floor if blind, such as a cockatrice or chickatrice corpse. Beware: you will always hit a warning symbol, and will also still attack a monster engulfing you.
  • Press m, to pick up items off the floor using a menu.
  • Press Shift + M, then a direction, to move your character as far as they can go in that direction. The character will not stop at items or corridor forks. See the article on movement for a comparison to other movement prefixes.

Contents

  • 1 Historical uses
  • 2 Variants
    • 2.1 SLASH'EM
    • 2.2 dNetHack
    • 2.3 SpliceHack
    • 2.4 EvilHack
    • 2.5 SlashTHEM
    • 2.6 Hack'EM

Historical uses

In Hack 1.21, based on Jay Fenlason's Hack, minotaurs used the m glyph, while mega-worms used the M glyph; in Hack for PDP-11, the m glyph is given to the mimic. Both minotaurs and mimics retain their glyphs for their appearance in Hack 1.0, and continue to use those glyphs up to NetHack 2.3e.

In NetHack 3.0.0, the mimic monster class is introduced and the three sizes of mimic are differentiated from each other, while the mummies are introduced and given the M glyph; the minotaur is moved to the giant humanoid monster class, H.

Variants

Relatively few variants add new monsters to the mimic monster class.

SLASH'EM

SLASH'EM introduces one new monster that uses the M glyph:

  • M mummy
    • M troll mummy

dNetHack

dNetHack adds several new monsters that use the M glyph:

  • M mummy
    • M drow mummy
    • M half-dragon mummy
    • M chiropteran mummy
    • M mummified android
    • M mummified gynoid
    • M alabaster mummy
    • M soldier mummy
    • M priest mummy
    • M pharaoh
    • M Nitocris
    • M Ghoul-queen Nitocris
    • M strange corpse

SpliceHack

SpliceHack adds two new monsters that use the m and M glyphs:

  • m mimic
    • m killer mimic
  • M mummy
    • M adherer

EvilHack

EvilHack adds two new monsters that use the M glyph:

  • M mummy
    • M hobbit mummy
    • M drow mummy

SlashTHEM

In addition to SLASH'EM details, SlashTHEM adds two new monsters that use the M glyph:

  • M mummy
    • M drow mummy
    • M ogre mummy

Hack'EM

Hack'EM adds a few new monsters that use the M glyph, including some from other variants:

  • M mummy
    • M hobbit mummy
    • M centaur mummy
    • M adherer
    • M troll mummy

rawPage:
{{ASCII}}
In ''[[NetHack]]'', the letter '''M''' serves the following purposes:

* {{white|m}} represents a [[mimic]] (when it is not disguised as something else):
** {{monsymlink|small mimic}}
** {{monsymlink|large mimic}}
** {{monsymlink|giant mimic}}

* {{white|M}} represents a [[mummy]]:
** {{monsymlink|kobold mummy}}
** {{monsymlink|gnome mummy}}
** {{monsymlink|orc mummy}}
** {{monsymlink|dwarf mummy}}
** {{monsymlink|elf mummy}}
** {{monsymlink|human mummy}}
** {{monsymlink|ettin mummy}}
** {{monsymlink|giant mummy}}

* Press {{kbd|m}}, then a direction, to move your character without performing any other actions (such as attacking a [[monster]] or displacing a [[pet]].
** Even if [[autopickup]] is on, using {{kbd|m}} causes you not to pick up anything. It will also stop you from attacking {{white|I}}, and will even stop you feeling items on the floor if [[blind]], such as a [[cockatrice]] or [[chickatrice]] [[corpse]]. '''Beware''': you will always hit a [[warning]] symbol, and will also still attack a monster [[engulfing]] you.
* Press {{kbd|m}}{{kbd|,}} to [[pick up]] items off the floor using a menu.
* Press {{kbd|Shift|M}}, then a direction, to move your character as far as they can go in that direction. The character will not stop at items or corridor forks. See the article on [[movement]] for a comparison to other movement prefixes.

==Historical uses==
In Hack 1.21, based on [[Jay Fenlason's Hack]], [[minotaur]]s used the {{white|m}} glyph, while mega-worms used the {{white|M}} glyph; in Hack for PDP-11, the {{white|m}} glyph is given to the [[Small mimic|mimic]]. Both minotaurs and mimics retain their glyphs for their appearance in [[Hack 1.0]], and continue to use those glyphs up to [[NetHack 2.3e]].

In [[NetHack 3.0.0]], the [[mimic]] [[monster class]] is introduced and the three sizes of mimic are differentiated from each other, while the mummies are introduced and given the {{white|M}} glyph; the minotaur is moved to the [[giant humanoid]] monster class, {{white|H}}.

==Variants==
Relatively few variants add new monsters to the mimic monster class.

===SLASH'EM===
[[SLASH'EM]] introduces one new monster that uses the {{white|M}} glyph:

* {{white|M}} mummy
** {{monsymlink|troll mummy}}

===dNetHack===
[[dNetHack]] adds several new monsters that use the {{white|M}} glyph:

* {{white|M}} mummy
** {{black|M}} [[drow mummy]]
** {{brightblue|M}} [[half-dragon mummy]]
** {{blue|M}} [[chiropteran mummy]]
** {{brown|M}} [[mummified android]]
** {{brown|M}} [[mummified gynoid]]
** {{white|M}} [[alabaster mummy]]
** {{brightgreen|M}} [[soldier mummy]]
** {{yellow|M}} [[priest mummy]]
** {{brightmagenta|M}} [[pharaoh]]
** {{black|M}} [[Nitocris]]
** {{black|M}} [[Ghoul-queen Nitocris]]
** {{magenta|M}} [[strange corpse]]

===SpliceHack===
[[SpliceHack]] adds two new monsters that use the {{white|m}} and {{white|M}} glyphs:

* {{white|m}} mimic
** {{green|m}} [[killer mimic]]
* {{white|M}} mummy
** {{yellow|M}} [[adherer]]

===EvilHack===
[[EvilHack]] adds two new monsters that use the {{white|M}} glyph:

* {{white|M}} mummy
** {{green|M}} [[hobbit mummy]]
** {{black|M}} [[Drow mummy (EvilHack)|drow mummy]]

===SlashTHEM===
In addition to SLASH'EM details, [[SlashTHEM]] adds two new monsters that use the {{white|M}} glyph:

* {{white|M}} mummy
** {{black|M}} [[Drow mummy (SlashTHEM)|drow mummy]]
** {{yellow|M}} [[ogre mummy]]

===Hack'EM===
Hack'EM adds a few new monsters that use the {{white|M}} glyph, including some from other variants:

* {{white|M}} mummy
** {{green|M}} [[hobbit mummy]]
** {{brightgreen|M}} [[centaur mummy]]
** {{yellow|M}} [[adherer]]
** {{monsymlink|troll mummy}}
